profiles:
Experience Engineering Director Google October 2011  – Present (3 years 11 months) Mountain View Having been at Google for a number of years, I feel very fortunate to be in a role where I'm now leading a 200+ person team involved in translating Google's philosophy and practices around attracting, developing, rewarding and retaining some of the most talented people in the world into the tools, applications and processes to support these Google-wide initiatives. 
 
I lead the engineering teams developing Google's people focused technology, including : 
HR systems 
Payroll 
Compensation Tools 
Performance and Calibration Processes 
Hiring Applications 
Learning and Development 
Benefits 
 
 
In addition to the application side I'm also responsible for some of the core backend systems (data pipelines and data storage solutions) that underpin and connect Google's internally developed enterprise systems well as integrating a number of third party SaaS solutions with Google's partners. Senior Engineering Manager - Google Analytics Google January 2010  –  October 2011  (1 year 10 months) Mountain View, Califonia Tasked with growing and developing teams in both the convergent tracking and social analytics area. Convergent tracking led to several successful launches in cross media analysis tools that now form an integral part of Google's Analytics Suite of Products. Search Funnels (Search Funnels shows the entire search path leading up to a conversion, including search ad clicks and impressions. These reports can provide you with data on how your "upper-funnel"​ keywords help conversions beyond just the last click) and Cross-Media Funnels. Responsible for the engineering coordination efforts around the acquisition of PostRank which formed the nucleus of Google's Social Analytics efforts. Software Engineer - CRM systems Google December 2008  –  November 2009  (1 year) After many years as an engineering manager I decided it was high time that I re-established my software development credentials and found a team that was courageous enough to give me the opportunity to re-learn everything I had forgotten during my stint as a manager. Google's Revenue and Reporting org gave me this opportunity.. Looking to remain in management over the long-term, but it's been a great experience re-learning the ropes and getting first hand experience of the challenges and changes in software development since I last had a 'hands-on' role. Senior Engineering Manager - Google Engineering Tools Google June 2005  –  December 2008  (3 years 7 months) Led a team of engineers tasked with developing and researching engineering productivity tools and supporting development process changes. Team launched a number of innovative new tools (whilst having to maintain and extend legacy systems) that helped scale and extend Google's build systems, source control and other development related tools (such as bug tracking, project management and code review applications) that considerably enhanced Google's world-wide software-engineering initiatives by being able to effectively scale to meet the challenges of significant growth in engineering numbers combined with a widely distributed engineering organization whilst supporting an intensely collaborative development philosophy. 
Initiated processes and tools to collect and disseminate issues impacting engineering productivity, kicked-off regular productivity section in engineering newsletter and helped initiate the engineering productivity review meetings to ensure better coordination between the various efforts in the Tools, Testing/QA and Documentation areas. 
The team was recognized with several quarterly technological achievement awards during my tenure. 
 
Started the initiative with an initial 6 engineers and grew the effort to encompass over 100 individuals in various locations around the world working on a variety of productivity related systems. Software Development Manager - Productivity Tools eBay June 2003  –  June 2005  (2 years 1 month) Created and maintained systems, tools, and processes for source code management, bug tracking, content management and localization, production and QA environment ticketing 
 
Streamlined and introduced heuristics to improve critical path code merge process for the eBay.com and International sites' intensive release process 
 
Introduced number of new tools and processes to both track release velocity and to considerably improve the performance and scalability of the underlying source control tools. 
 
Designed and built up a scalable, reliable and fault-tolerant source control infrastructure involving building out a new server room from the scratch, improved power supplies and a new generation of hardware and processes. Involved liaising with contractors, vendors, hardware suppliers and internal groups to meet full set of requirements. Senior Software Engineer eBay August 2000  –  June 2003  (2 years 11 months) San Jose Senior software engineer in Intl Development team - developing and launching new international sites for eBay, as well as L10N and I18N work and integration of these systems with other areas within eBay such as payment and billing systems. Software Engineer Kenan 1998  –  2000  (2 years) Greater Boston Area Integrated and versatile billing system used by many of the major telecom companies and more recently by some of larger and more successful web companies. Software Engineer Lucent Technologies 1998  –  2000  (2 years) Boston Senior Software Engineer Julian Hodge Bank May 1997  –  May 1998  (1 year 1 month) Cardiff, United Kingdom Senior software engineer role responsible for developing and maintenance of C/UNIX based banking and financial reporting systems for private UK Bank. [Hiring exceptional software engineers in Mountain View and SFO!]  Experience Engineering Director Google May 2015  – Present (4 months) Mountain View, CA Google Technical Infrastructure Resource Management.  
 
Responsible for the efficient utilization for all the Google data centers through software, services, and business operations. 
 
All Google products (e.g. search, ads, Google Cloud, Gmail, YouTube, Maps, Android, etc) rely on our software to manage their machine, compute, and storage needs.  
 
Software and services focus areas include cloud resource distribution, efficiency management, product catalog, pricing automation, demand planning, fleet planning, ordering, cost allocation, usage collection, financial policy control, data warehouse, and reporting. 
 
 General Manager, Amazon WorkDocs Amazon September 2014  –  May 2015  (9 months) Palo Alto, CA Founding member of Amazon WorkDocs team and general manager. Hired the entire team starting from zero. Acting principal engineer. Owner for all aspects of Product, Business, Engineering, Operations, and QA. 
 
Amazon WorkDocs is AWS's solution for secure document storage with simple cross-document collaboration and tight integration with Amazon WorkSpaces, Amazon WorkMail, AWS Directory Service, AWS CloudTrail, Amazon S3 and more.  
 
http://aws.amazon.com/workdocs/ 
 
One of the site leaders for AWS Palo Alto office. Hired the entire engineering team starting from zero. Acting principal engineer. Responsible for all aspects of Engineering, Operations, and QA. 
 
Amazon WorkDocs is AWS's solution for secure document storage with simple cross-document collaboration and tight integration with Amazon WorkSpaces, Amazon WorkMail, AWS Directory Service, AWS CloudTrail, Amazon S3 and more.  
 
http://aws.amazon.com/workdocs/ VP of Engineering SendMe, Inc. November 2010  –  June 2012  (1 year 8 months) Tactical engineering lead (30 person team) with direct responsibility for development team (15 person team). 
 
Reshapped team through recruiting, recruiting, and more recruiting. 
 
Implemented Atlassian suite and agile practices: Jira, Greenhopper, Fisheye, Bamboo, and Confluence. 
 
All mergers, acquisitions, and divestitures successful by technical measures and are exceeding business expectations: Thumbplay, Snackable Media, Media Breakaway, and Mbuzzy. The key reason? Data!  
 
Multiple distinct codes bases consisting of Java, LAMP, Android, IPhone, Web, WAP, Coldfusion, MySql, PostGres, and MS SQL Server. 
 
Moved away from standard data center hosting to the AWS cloud, taking us from four data centers to a single presence in AWS controlled entirely through Dev-Ops methodologies. 
 
In less than two years, my team has accomplished some of the largest and most complicated development tasks in SendMe’s history. Through our efforts to consolidate systems and hosting, we have saved the company nearly $2,000,000 USD in yearly overhead, while increasing performance and stability of the core platform. Founder and Board Member Blog Traffic Exchange, Inc. January 2009  –  February 2012  (3 years 2 months) The Blog Traffic Exchange is an Amazon cloud based service based on the SEO concepts behind various blog related posts plugins. Using proprietary chaos and relevancy algorithms in conjunction with the Sphinx open source full text index engine, the Blog Traffic Exchange exists to increase your blog traffic by exchanging readers with other members. Built and lead a world class 12 person team.

Specialties: Machine Learning, Mobile Computing, Ranking, Large-scale Distributed Systems, Engineering Management, Personalization, Recommender Systems, Revenue Optimization Experience Engineering Director at Google Play Google May 2015  – Present (4 months) My teams are responsible for search, discovery, personalization, revenue optimization, abuse prevention, and merchandizing over Play apps and games. Google Play is rapidly growing, now the most used mobile application in the world. It is also the biggest software distribution platform in the world, by far, across all mobile operating systems. As the installed user base, content, and number of devices all increase, Play backend systems become critically more important. Come join us! 
 
1. Search: As content and users both go mobile, how can we improve indexing and ranking for the world's largest marketplace for digital content? 
 
2. Discovery: How can we build even better browse and queryless consumption experiences to delight our users, for example via top charts and cross-sell collections? 
 
3. Personalization: How can we use large scale machine learning to better personalize the Play Store's home page and other personalized features? 
 
4. Revenue optimization: Google Play is not just a content corpus -- it is a store. How do we help our developers increase their revenue? 
 
5. Abuse prevention: How can we make Google Play a safe environment for our users? 
 
6. Merchandizing and human curation: How could we provide better tools and algorithms to merchandizers to aid human curation? 
 
7. Infrastructure: The base that powers this all. All about Google scale. 
 
We are looking for engineers, leads, engineering managers, and product managers. Send me a note! Senior Staff Engineering Manager, Google Play Google August 2013  –  April 2015  (1 year 9 months) My teams worked on search, discovery, abuse prevention, email marketing and merchandizing over Play corpora of apps, games, music, movies, books and devices. Staff Engineering Manager at Google Search Google August 2012  –  July 2013  (1 year) My teams worked on new user experiences for Google web and image search, focused on content exploration and discovery. Our work spans the whole spectrum -- from algorithm design to coding to serving infrastructure, logging, UI/UX development, and machine learning/personalization. Engineering Manager at Google Research Google April 2010  –  July 2012  (2 years 4 months) Second level manager for machine learning and multimedia content analysis for YouTube and Android. Received OC award (honorable mention) in December 2010. Gave invited talks on large scale machine learning at LinkedIn, Netflix, eBay, and Microsoft, and universities including MIT, Brown, and UC Berkeley. 
 
Researchers and engineers on my teams have had a broad portfolio, from computer vision and audio analysis to large scale machine learning and NLP. Some of the projects from my team have had significant impact on revenue (generating $XXX million/year), whereas some have been about innovative experimental products. In addition, my teams have also published several papers in premier conferences.

§ eVantage 
 
Conceptualized, created the road map and delivered a new eDiscovery product, eVantage. Recruited development team in US and India and managed the development process to deliver a full-featured product in less than 12 months from concept to ship. Product included high performance database architecture, full-text search using Lucene, highly-performance document processing pipeline and a modern interactive UI using state-of-the-art frameworks. Delivered upgrades to the product in regular succession. 
 
Provided leadership to cross-functional team consisting of engineering, marketing, sales, support, and training to launch the product and to create the support infrastructure to sell and support the product. 
 
§ Nearpoint: hosted and on-premise email and file archiving 
 
Lead a team of more than 80 engineers in the US and India on a comprehensive hosted and on-premise email and file management solution providing archiving, search and restore. Using a patented technology, Nearpoint captures email content and detailed meta-data. The email content is available to be searched by the individual mail box owners as well as auditors for restoration and discovery purposes through a rich interactive UI. 
 
Worked closely with support and professional services organizations to implement scalable and manageable support protocols to support more than 1000 customers of the product.
